intro: Atasites, commonly known as the "false ginseng," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their upright, herbaceous stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. They produce small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Atasites species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits, though scientific validation of these uses remains limited.
